channel.title: Error Running Source
channel.description: I ran my server fine for a few days but I suddenly got this error... [PacketManager] Loading packet handlers... [PacketManager] Loaded 46 packet handlers. [ClanManager] Loading clans.... [RS2Server] Loaded cache. [ClanManager] Loaded 6 clans. [AreaManager] Loading areas... com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.StreamException: : Connection timed out: connect at com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.xml.DomDriver.createReader(DomDriver.java :88) at ce) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at item.title: Error Running Source
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“zingerman111, post:7, topic:417428”]ive fixed this problem before its just in the client the ip is still linked to marcob’s so just change that
to either your no-ip or 127.0.0.1 or your whatsmyip.org either of these will work and there’s also a
gui.java you also need to correct the ip there the main thing is in the config.java you need to take ip off
that.[/quote]

This isn’t some shitty PI server with 640 items and other shit packed into it. This is a 614 server, a real 614 server, that loads 634 items, NPCs, maps, and objects. There is no ‘Config.java’. This has absolutely nothing to do with the client. The server does not start up whatsoever.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Running Source
item.dc:creator: @zingerman111 zingerman111
item.description:
@zingerman111 wrote:

ive fixed this problem before its just in the client the ip is still linked to marcob’s so just change that
to either your no-ip or 127.0.0.1 or your whatsmyip.org either of these will work and there’s also a
gui.java you also need to correct the ip there the main thing is in the config.java you need to take ip off
that.

Read full topic

devenb123:

he has an antileech maybe? didnt read it fully but a 639 with error running source sounds like an antileech read the comments on its server download page

I’m pretty sure it doesn’t have an anti-leach

item.title: Error Running Source
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Ahh so it’s not just me.
I’m trying to fix that now. Now I realize that some link is probably connected to marcbob’s website and maybe he removed that certain file.
